text: Richard Alan "Ric" Drasin (July 12, 1944 - August 30, 2020) was an American bodybuilder, personal trainer, actor, stuntman, author, and former professional wrestler. He wrestled professionally for 36 years between 1965 and 2001. American Wrestling Federation Website. Ric and Joe Gold. (Retrieved on February 19, 2007.) Drasin was born in Bakersfield, California. He began his fitness career in 1962. He taught classes in nutrition and exercise at the YMCA. He trained with the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) champion Mae Young.
